snippet: Despite growing jitters in the West, Ukraine’s military leaders said they were making a well-calculated gamble, betting that Vladimir V. Putin of Russia felt he had too much to lose to invade.
abstract: Ukrainian military commanders press ahead with offensive to drive pro-Russian rebels from their stronghold in Donetsk, despite warnings from Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin that he could intervene at any time to protect Ukrainians who favor closer times with his country; believe Putin has too much to lose to invade, and is mobilizing troops as a scare tactic to keep Ukraine from reclaiming territory.

byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon contributed reporting from Naypyidaw, Myanmar.

lead_paragraph: Despite growing jitters in the West, Ukraine’s military leaders said they were making a well-calculated gamble, betting that Vladimir V. Putin of Russia felt he had too much to lose to invade.

headline.main: Ukraine Strategy Bets on Restraint by Russia
headline.print_headline: Ukraine Strategy Bets on Restraint by Russia
